channel.title: Metal Gear: Ground Zero
channel.description:
![](upload://pt1EG6Zrjv9dImgdJc2xtsQSejp.jpeg)
[url]https://asia.gamespot.com/metal-gear-solid-ground-zeroes/previews/metal-gear-solid-ground-zeroes-shows-off-fox-engine-shine-and-possible-open-world-elements-6393924/[/url]
I've been hearing conflicting information about this. That it's going to be a new game or that it's just a tech demo for Kojima's new Fox Engine. Some sources are saying that it's just Metal Gear and others are having the Solid in there as well. It's supposedly going to be still a prequel that takes place after 3. Open world seems to be part of it also. The link above is a description of some gameplay from it. There's also supposed to be 30 minutes of gameplay uploaded at some point today.
While I kind of wish they would just let Metal Gear (Solid) die as 4 I felt was a nice conclusion, I'm pretty excited.
Edit: A pic from the coming gameplay video. ![](upload://bPAmEir7jc20TNNOXAedHF9tzHU.jpeg) Kojima has said that this is running on a PC "similarly equipped to a PS3" and will be running on current gen systems. Either he's full of shit or he's a wizard.

item.title: Metal Gear: Ground Zero
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
The matter is, stuff he says to Sigint contradicts what he hears from the boss, and XM16e1 is the only item it happens with.

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear: Ground Zero

item.description:
Yeah and the fact is, it is impossible in one playthrough. Fucking XM16e1 below the bridge.

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear: Ground Zero
item.dc:creator: Kaweebo
item.description:
Well cause I remember the first or second time I played MGS3, and I wanted to listen to every single Codec call in the game. So I sat there, first area of the game, for a good hour or half an hour just listening to Codec calls. I even skipped the unimportant ones that just basically tell you how to shoot your gun and stuff like that and it still took me about an hour. Just in that first area after getting the backpack.

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear: Ground Zero
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
‘suddenly I got this irresistible urge to get inside’

Still fresh. Finished my playthrough of Subsistence a couple days ago.
You can see that he went all out in those codecs, despite MGS3 being intentionally simple.

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear: Ground Zero
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Ah, must have missed that Codec call.

“Gah! Is everyone hooked up with the Major strange?!?”

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear: Ground Zero
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Soviet Sneaking suit and EVA suit are actually the same models - Snake outright tells that to Sigint.

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear: Ground Zero
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
The MGS3 sneaking suit looked more ridged, almost like an EVA suit, honestly.

These look more similar to Peace Walker’s Sneaking Suit.

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear: Ground Zero
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

So Snake is not yet gray. I guess, add that to the piggybank of disappointments too

OldDirtyBastard:

Solid Snake doesn’t have an eyepatch on his right socket. Naked Snake did.
Solid Snake did not have an MSF badge on his sneaking suit. Naked Snake (unfortunately, admittedly) had.

Not to mention Solid Snake’s sneaking suits had a different design than Big Boss’s sneaking suits. The suit in the images floating around all resemble the suit from MGS3.

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear: Ground Zero
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Dotard:

The former statement of Kojima and this https://www.gamespot.com/metal-gear-solid-ground-zeroes/previews/metal-gear-solid-ground-zeroes-shows-off-fox-engine-shine-and-possible-open-world-elements-6393924/ might have confused me, obviously gamespot has it wrong.

Taking gamespot words at face value and not being able to deduct at the most primitive level. kay

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear: Ground Zero
item.dc:creator: squiffel
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

Rim lights is plausible.
Fill lights and key lights from the front (leave alone in complete shadows) - bullshit.

They fucked with sub-surface scattering too much

Well thats what I meant, the rim lights dont account for the rest of the image which isnt over exposed.

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear: Ground Zero
item.dc:creator: Kaweebo
item.description:
Dotard:

In the former footage, it was clearly an old dude with the tape over his right eye and the same face as Big Boss, thus him- the naked snake.

Then people asked who is that, and Kojima answered it’s Solid Snake but he is still young, and it was just a result of lighting reflections or something.

Thus I say, the guy has lost it.
EDIT: might be a mistake from journalists, they fuck up everything all the time

The only time Kojima mentioned Solid was when he said ‘“We have not yet finished with Solid Snake, despite the fact that I wanted to let him die at the end of Guns of the Patriots”’ in regards to an MGS5. This is not MGS5. So, if he really meant Solid Snake, it’s definitely not with this game.

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear: Ground Zero
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Is it called Ground Zero or Ground Zeroes?

Zeroes

Dotard:

I say bullshit, the guy in the first footage was obviously the Big Boss, no lighting effect shit excuse can make up for that.

He likely realized the dozens of time-line errors, so switched to Solid Snake in the last moment

sigh
Dotard being a tard again.
https://twitter.com/Kojima_Hideo/status/243267764045885441/photo/1

768×1024

Solid Snake doesn’t have an eyepatch on his right socket. Naked Snake did.
Solid Snake did not have an MSF badge on his sneaking suit. Naked Snake (unfortunately, admittedly) had.

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear: Ground Zero
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Kojima said that after finishing MGS 4. He said that he won’t be touching Snake’s path ever again and I think that’s a really good decision.

Surprise, fucker:
https://gematsu.com/2012/06/kojima-confirms-metal-gear-solid-5
Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance never claimed to be a Metal Gear Solid. This is not a game about our beloved Solid Snake. It is a spinoff that tries something different. We have not yet finished with Solid Snake, despite the fact that I wanted to let him die at the end of Guns of the Patriots.[/SIZE]

Where is your god now?

On the other hand, Big Boss has a long path ahead of him before getting actually to Outer Heaven. I think that Kojima will stop doing Metal Gear games when he makes Big Boss and Solid Snake fight again like in the very first Metal Gear.

fan
boy

P.S. Also OH MY GOD WTF NOW
https://twitter.com/HIDEO_KOJIMA_EN/status/243217008903196672
So Snake is not yet gray. I guess, add that to the piggybank of disappointments too

Read full topic
